intro: Bunchosia jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican bunchosia, is a shrub native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Bunchosia jamaicensis is often found in coastal and disturbed habitats, showing adaptability to various environmental conditions.
